TypeSignature.Value: public class Preference : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.Lang.IComparable
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Preference extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Lang.IComparable, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Represents the basic Preference UI building block displayed by a in the form of a .

remarks.para: Represents the basic Preference UI building block displayed by a in the form of a . This class provides the to be displayed in the activity and associates with a to store/retrieve the preference data.
When specifying a preference hierarchy in XML, each element can point to a subclass of , similar to the view hierarchy and layouts.

This class contains a key that will be used as the key into the . It is up to the subclass to decide how to store the value.
Developer Guides
For information about building a settings UI with Preferences, read the Settings guide.

Docs.param: To be added.
To be added.
Docs.summary: Constructor that is called when inflating a Preference from XML.

remarks.para: Constructor that is called when inflating a Preference from XML. This is called when a Preference is being constructed from an XML file, supplying attributes that were specified in the XML file. This version uses a default style of 0, so the only attribute values applied are those in the Context's Theme and the given AttributeSet.

Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

MemberSignature.Value: public Preference (Android.Content.Context context, Android.Util.IAttributeSet attrs, int defStyleAttr);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Android.Content.Context context, class Android.Util.IAttributeSet attrs, int32 defStyleAttr) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Docs.summary: Perform inflation from XML and apply a class-specific base style.

remarks.para: Perform inflation from XML and apply a class-specific base style. This constructor of Preference allows subclasses to use their own base style when they are inflating. For example, a constructor calls this version of the super class constructor and supplies android.R.attr.checkBoxPreferenceStyle for defStyleAttr. This allows the theme's checkbox preference style to modify all of the base preference attributes as well as the class's attributes.

For example, a constructor calls this version of the super class constructor and supplies android.R.attr.checkBoxPreferenceStyle for defStyleAttr. This allows the theme's checkbox preference style to modify all of the base preference attributes as well as the class's attributes.

Docs.summary: Returns the of this Preference.

remarks.para: Returns the of this Preference. Each Preference in a Preference hierarchy can be from different Context (for example, if multiple activities provide preferences into a single ). This Context will be used to save the Preference values.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns the key of the dependency on this Preference.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the key of a Preference that this Preference will depend on. If that Preference is not set or is off, this Preference will be disabled.

Docs.summary: Returns an where this Preference can save its value(s).

remarks.para: Returns an where this Preference can save its value(s). Usually it's easier to use one of the helper save methods: , , , , . To read values, see . If returns true, it is this Preference's responsibility to commit.
In some cases, writes to this will not be committed right away and hence not show up in the SharedPreferences, this is intended behavior to improve performance.

Docs.summary: Return the extras Bundle object associated with this preference, creating a new Bundle if there currently isn't one.

Docs.param: The set of attributes.
The index of the default value attribute.
Docs.summary: Called when a Preference is being inflated and the default value attribute needs to be read.

remarks.para: Called when a Preference is being inflated and the default value attribute needs to be read. Since different Preference types have different value types, the subclass should get and return the default value which will be its value type.
For example, if the value type is String, the body of the method would proxy to .

Docs.summary: Hook allowing a Preference to re-apply a representation of its internal state that had previously been generated by .

remarks.para: Hook allowing a Preference to re-apply a representation of its internal state that had previously been generated by . This function will never be called with a null state.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.OS.IParcelable OnSaveInstanceState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Hook allowing a Preference to generate a representation of its internal state that can later be used to create a new instance with that same state.

remarks.para: Hook allowing a Preference to generate a representation of its internal state that can later be used to create a new instance with that same state. This state should only contain information that is not persistent or can be reconstructed later.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnSetInitialValue (bool restorePersistedValue, Java.Lang.Object defaultValue);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnSetInitialValue(bool restorePersistedValue, class Java.Lang.Object defaultValue) cil managed

Docs.param: True to restore the persisted value; false to use the given defaultValue.
The default value for this Preference. Only use this if restorePersistedValue is false.
Docs.summary: Implement this to set the initial value of the Preference.

remarks.para: Implement this to set the initial value of the Preference.

If restorePersistedValue is true, you should restore the Preference value from the . If restorePersistedValue is false, you should set the Preference value to defaultValue that is given (and possibly store to SharedPreferences if is true).
This may not always be called. One example is if it should not persist but there is no default value given.

Sets the order of this Preference with respect to other Preference objects on the same level. If this is not specified, the default behavior is to sort alphabetically. The can be used to order Preference objects based on the order they appear in the XML.

remarks.para: Checks whether, at the given time this method is called, this Preference should store/restore its value(s) into the . This, at minimum, checks whether this Preference is persistent and it currently has a key. Before you save/restore from the , check this first.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int WidgetLayoutResource { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets the layout resource for the controllable widget portion of this Preference.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the layout resource for the controllable widget portion of this Preference.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the layout for the controllable widget portion of this Preference. This is inflated into the main layout. For example, a would specify a custom layout (consisting of just the CheckBox) here, instead of creating its own main layout.
